Advanced AcquisitionApplets for microEnable IV AD4-CL/PoCL, AD4-LVDS, and VD4-CL/PoCL

Content

mE 4 A-Series Area Scan (Camera Link & LVDS)
mE 4 A-Series Line Scan (Camera Link & LVDS)
mE 4 V-Series Area Scan (Camera Link)
mE 4 V-Series Line Scan (Camera Link)


The following Advanced AcquisitionApplets support Camera Link (Dual) Base, Medium, and Full/Deca configuration cameras. All applets supporting Camera Link (Dual) Base on frame grabber microEnable AD4-CL also support LVDS on frame grabber AD4-LVDS (on an 8-bit basis).

Each individual applet offers a specific image processing functionality.

IThe following image processing features have been implemented in the whole set of Advanced AcquisitionApplets for microEnable IV Camera Link frame grabbers. Each individual applet offers a useful combination of some of these features.

  • Shading Correction, including Dead Pixel Interpolation (DPI):
    A two-dimensional area shading correction. It consists of a subtractive offset correction and a multiplicative gain correction. Correction values can be defined for each pixel. Moreover, an auto-shading correction can be performed by loading black and gray reference images into the shading module.
  • Image Selector:
    An image selector facilitates the selection of certain images out of a parameterizable sequence of images (e.g., when only every third image is to be transported into the PC memory via the PC bus). In combination with a Camera Link I/O module and at least one second frame grabber, this allows for the distribution of images to multiple frame grabbers and PCs.
  • Noise Filter
    A median filter can be used to reduce image noise.
  • Trigger:
    A multi-functional area trigger is included to control the camera or external devices using grabber generated, external, or software generated trigger pulses.
  • ROI Selection
    A ROI can be selected for further processing. The stepsize of the ROI width is 4 pixel. The stepsize of the ROI height is 1 lines.
  • Bayer Pattern de-mosaicing and White Balancing
    The high-quality Bayer pattern de-mosaicing is based on a 5x5 kernel size. A white balancing module for individual gain of each color component enhances image quality.
  • Lookup Table
    The full resolution lookup table can either be configured by using a user defined table, or by using a processor. The processor gives the opportunity to use pre-defined functions such as offset, gain, and gamma to enhance the image quality. Color components are basically processed individually.


The tables below list the applets which applets are available for specific frame grabbers models.


Specific feature overview of all available Advanced AcquisitionApplets
for microEnable IV AD4-CL/-PoCL and microEnable IV AD4-LVDS


The following tables list the applets for area and line scan cameras with their features ordered by camera interface. All applets supporting Camera Link (Dual)Base also support LVDS on an 8-bit basis.

A detailed documentation of each feature in the context of its usage can be found in the specific applet documention. At the end of each table line, you find a link to the corresponding applet documention in HTML and PDF format.

Important Note:


- The actual DMA bandwidth depends on the specific mainboard and chip set.

- "Dual" applets enable the usage of up to two individual cameras in parallel (asynchronously and synchronously). All features of this type of applets are available for both cameras.

- The applets and their features are fully supported by the viewer software microDisplay and by the Silicon Software runtime environment including the powerful Software Development Kit (SDK).

SDK examples overview
